h2.title: Why Convert BMP to PNG?
h2.description:
BMP files are typically uncompressed and extremely large, while PNG offers modern features and efficient size. Benefits of converting BMP to PNG:

  • Better Compression: PNG files are commonly 50–90% smaller than BMP.
  • Transparency Support: PNG supports alpha transparency for clean edges.
  • Web Compatibility: Ideal for websites and online sharing.
  • Universal Support: Works across all modern devices and apps.
  • Quality Preservation: Lossless compression maintains detail.

h2.title: How to Convert BMP to PNG Online
h2.description:
Just a few steps:

  1. Click Upload BMP and select your file.
  2. Wait for processing and optimization.
  3. Click Download PNG to save your optimized file.

No technical skills required — compression is tuned automatically.

h2.title: BMP vs PNG Comparison
h2.description:
• File Size: PNG usually 50–90% smaller than BMP.
  • Compression: PNG is lossless; BMP is generally uncompressed.
  • Transparency: PNG supports transparency; BMP typically does not.
  • Web Use: PNG is web-friendly; BMP is not recommended.
  • Quality: Both can be high quality; PNG achieves it with smaller size.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: BMP (image/bmp)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: PNG (.png, MIME image/png)
  • Compression level: 0–9 (default 6)

h2.title: Features of Our BMP to PNG Converter
h2.description:
• 100% free, no watermarks
  • Automatic compression optimization
  • Quality preserved (lossless PNG)
  • Secure, browser-based workflow

h2.title: What is BMP?
h2.description: BMP (Bitmap) is a simple raster image format, often uncompressed — resulting in very large files. It's compatible but inefficient for the web.

h2.title: What is PNG?
h2.description: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) is a lossless raster format with transparency support, widely used for UI, graphics, screenshots, and the web.

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Upload failed: Ensure the file is BMP and ≤ 16 MB.
  • PNG still large: Try a lower compression level or use our Image Compressor.
  • Transparency needed: PNG supports transparency, but if your BMP has a solid background, remove it first with Background Remover.

h2.title: Use Cases: When to Convert BMP to PNG
h2.description:
• Web uploads with smaller size.
  • Graphics & logos needing transparent backgrounds.
  • Storage optimization without quality loss.
  • Cross-platform sharing and archiving.
